text: I heard some gypsies came to town.
Is it true that they are fortune tellers?
That's nonsense. Let's go and see them.
I wonder what advice they could give me?
Not today. It's getting late and the forest at this time is not safe.
Ah ah. Don't worry, Sir. I will take care of Bob.
I know you will, Alan, I know you will.
Bob is my best friend. I will not let anything happen to him.
Very well, I'm always trusting you. Go,
go ahead and have fun both of you.
Thank you father.
(Growling sound)
Ah did ah did you hear that?
Shh,
it's a bear.
My father was right. It's getting dark and the
forest is not safe for us.
Um..
We will be fine, um.. don't worry.
Alan look, it's the bear. It's in the middle of the path.
Ah   Oh no, run  run
Run  uh uh
Let me  the first one to climb the tree.
Fine let me help you.
Get into my shoulders.
uh Give me your hand uh hurry up.
There is no room for the both of us, find another place to hide.
God,  what can I do now?
Hmm. I have heared my father telling me that a bear will not touch a dead body.
So I will lay flat on the ground and pretend that I am dead. haah
Oh,
Bob
I thought the bear was going to attack you.
I saw him whispering something to your ear.  Oh
Oh he he was a fortune teller bear .A fortune teller Bear?
Uh, Yes, he came along with the gypsies, and he read my palms.
Really? What did he say?
He told me never to travel with a friend who deserts me at the first sign of trouble.
Just the advice I'd needed.
um
I'm so sorry.
Okay, I'm going home.
Goodbye.
Dear children, can you guess the moral of the story?  yes.  It's nothing but,
Misfortune tests, the sincerity between friends.
